fields.description:
I can't quite put my finger on this one, but there definitely seems to be something strange with the exclamation mark emoticon (!). Under some circumstances it will get interpretated as part of an image link. In the following snippet Confluence tries to render the first (!) as an image link: |(!) |! |(!) |? |(!) | ! Result:
(
?
!
fields.summary: (!) emoticon sometimes interpretated as image link

fields.description:
In Confluence 1.3.x the first parameter to a user macro used to be called param1, and it was referenced as $param1. This is also how it's documented: http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/User+Macros.

In Confluence 1.4 OTOH the first parameter is now param0.

I am not sure whether this change was made inadvertently or if the documentation hasn't been updated yet.
fields.summary: First parameter to user macro is param0 not param1

fields.description:
User created a page, added image attachments and used thumbnail to show images on page. User replaced images with new images but used the same names as before (deleted old ones first). Thumbnails continues to show old images. Clicking on image shows correct image. 

Seems like it is caching the old thumbnail image is cached.
fields.summary: Old thumbnail image cached

fields.description:
Incorrect or invalid pages show up in the listing on the undefined pages list:

* escaped brackets in wiki markup content are incorrectly classified as a link
* CamelCase links after CamelCase linking has been disabled
* a invalid link on a page like \[Test$%]

Much of this is due to the lack of a proper wiki parser, so there is no simple solution to this issue.

The symptoms are that an incorrect link shows up on the Undefined Pages list. Depending on which type of invalid link it is, when clicking the link to create the page the page title may be invalid.
fields.summary: Incorrect listings on undefined pages list

fields.description:
When adding a page to a Space, you can designate the parent page in a number of different ways.  One very cool way to specify the parent page is to perform a search for a page.

When i attempt to perform a search for a page in the "Choose a Page" dialog box, my searches always return nothing despite the fact that I have content in the site.  It doesn't matter whether or not i search across all spaces or in a particular space.  I varied the query in a number of ways, eventually explicitly naming a pages title that i knew existed but it didn't work.

I re-indexed the site (299 objects were re-indexed) and tried again, but no go.  I bounced tomcat but still no go.

No weirdness in Tomcat logs, though I haven't turned up the debugging either.
fields.summary: When adding a page and designating its parent, searching for a page does not work.

fields.description:
The search does 'word stemming' by default, even though you put quotes around the search term. The following examples are searches on confluence.atlassian.com.

For example a search for the 'show to macro' with the search term: "{show-to}" will give you heaps of results with only 'show' as a keyword.
The fact that not the whole seach term is used but a stemmed part seems to be related to the special chars like the hyphen in this search.

A search for: "Theme Helper" will give you only one result with the right page. However, only the word 'theme' is highlighted in the result. It seems that the stemming is used for the highlighting. Unfortunately this gives the impression of an unsuccessful search.
fields.summary: Search gives unexpected results

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-3343].
  {panel}

The idea is to allow access to a space via a domain cleanly so that Confluence becomes a sort of CMS. Currently one could just forward the entire url e.g. /confluence/display/<space>/<page> to the Confluence app however it would be nice if <domain>/<page> could be the URL instead.

I have managed to get some of the way along with the following Apache rewrite, using mod_jk2 to forward to Tomcat with Confluence installed as /. I have a mapping file to translate the domain name into a space key.

RewriteEngine on
# Set map to convert to lowercase
RewriteMap       lowercase      int:tolower
# Set map type and path
RewriteMap   vhost              txt:/etc/apache2/maps/vhost
# HTTP_HOST not blank
#RewriteCond %{HTTP_HOST}  !^$
# Convert HTTP_HOST to lowercase
RewriteCond  ${lowercase:%{HTTP_HOST}|NONE}  ^((dev|stage)\.)?(.+)$
# Search for host in vhost map
RewriteCond  ${vhost:%3}  ^(.*)$
# Prefix path with vhost search result and set environment variable "VHOST"
RewriteRule  ^(.*)$   $1  [E=VHOST:${lowercase:%{HTTP_HOST}},E=SPACE:%1]

RewriteRule  ^/display/\w+(/?.*)        $1      [R,L]
RewriteRule  ^/display/(~.*)    /user/$1        [R,L]
RewriteRule  ^/$                        /Home
RewriteRule  ^/(styles/.*)$   /$1?spaceKey=%{ENV:SPACE}  [QSA,PT,L]
RewriteRule  ^/user/(~.*)$ /display/$1 [PT,L]
RewriteRule  ^/(decorators|pages|images|spaces|download|x|rpc|admin)(/(.*))?$ /$1/$3 [PT,L]
RewriteRule  ^/(.*\.action.*)$ /$1 [PT,L]
#RewriteRule  ^(/display/%{ENV:SPACE})?/(.*)$   /display/%{ENV:SPACE}/$2  [PT,L]
RewriteRule  ^/(.*)$   /display/%{ENV:SPACE}/$1  [PT,L]

It would be nice if this could be done a little cleaner e.g. pass the space key as a querystring parameter to every request or prefix every URI with the space key e.g.
/display/Home?spaceKey=<space>   or
/<space>/display/Home    or
/styles/<space>/Home
fields.summary: Domain to space mapping

fields.description:
By default the search on confluence assumes 'OR' between multiple words in the query. Most search sites (like Google) realized in about 1998 that most people want (and now expect) the default to be 'AND'. The default should be 'AND' and of course it would be best if this were configurable per instance or per space.

Also, it seems that some 'word stemming' is done by default. It would be nice to be able to turn that off. An example which we have seen here is someone searching for the name 'Walles' which matched a page with 'Wall' in the title, strange and unexpected!!
fields.summary: Allow configuration of default search

fields.summary: All links should allow opening through the HREF attribute

fields.description:
See CONF-3333

"First, how the PreRenderedMailNotificationQueueItems get to the error queue. Most of our users did not bother choosing between text and html email notifications, so their confluence.prefs.email.mimetype comes from preferences-default.xml and is equal to "html". Due to apparent typo in MailNotificationQueueItem#getMimeTypeForUser (MailNotificationQueueItem.java around line 159), string "html" is not considered to represent html content and is used as is by SMTPMailServerImpl. Since "html" is not know mime type, send message fails with javax.mail.ParseException. By the way, ErrorQueuedTaskQueue#handleException looses nested exceptions and stack trace and all I saw in the logs was almost useless "send message failed"."
fields.summary: Default email MIME type is not valid

fields.description:
We consistently get OutOfMemoryErrors after running Confluence for several days. Java heapdump (ibm jdk feature) shows 149 PreRenderedMailNotificationQueueItems that sit in ErrorQueuedTaskQueue holding 100M+ of memory from garbage colection (heapdump file can be provided for your amusement). I've spent some time looking into this problem and here is what I found

First, how the PreRenderedMailNotificationQueueItems get to the error queue. Most of our users did not bother choosing between text and html email notifications, so their confluence.prefs.email.mimetype comes from preferences-default.xml and is equal to "html". Due to apparent typo in MailNotificationQueueItem#getMimeTypeForUser (MailNotificationQueueItem.java around line 159), string "html" is not considered to represent html content and is used as is by SMTPMailServerImpl. Since "html" is not know mime type, send message fails with javax.mail.ParseException. By the way, ErrorQueuedTaskQueue#handleException looses nested exceptions and stack trace and all I saw in the logs was almost useless "send message failed".

Second, why PreRenderedMailNotificationQueueItems hold so much RAM. Although I am not 100% sure but looking at the heapdump and the source code it appears that PreRenderedMailNotificationQueueItems.VelocityRenderedQueueItem#context holds whole bunch of different stuff, including http request, response and much more. Since PreRenderedMailNotificationQueueItem is already pre-rendered you may as well clean VelocityRenderedQueueItem#context and probably other members before queueing it for delivery. Another suggestion is to make ErrorQueuedTaskQueue weak -- I would rather loose few *failed* mail notifications than my entire wiki server.

Hope this helps. I've made some changes to our local Confluence installation to help me debug this problem better and I will update this bug report if I find something new.

--
Regards,
Igor
fields.summary: OutOfMemoryError

eg. Old:

eg. New

The baz header is indicated as a new change, but the last blank cell is ignored.

fields.summary: Page Conflict screen incorrect

fields.description:
The export process for pdf and html relies upon images being made available on the local filesystem. When it comes to thumbnails (generated from the original image by a servlet) this is no longer possible - there is no local file system representation of the thumbnail of an image.

Options:

A) for PDF, reference the absolute url for an image (thumbnailed or otherwise) within the fo document. This will allow the system to do whatever processing is required to generate the image. The problem here is authentication. When the pdf generation process sends a request to the server, it needs to be authenticated with the users credentials. Adding the users credentials to the url is not an option as this would leave a trail of username/password entries on the servers access logs. Somehow we need to assume the identity of the current http requests user.

B) write the thumbnails to disk when they are viewed, and then use this 'disk cache' to serve the export process. A complication to this is ensuring that we keep the thumbnails up to date when the original image is changed, deleting the thumbnail when the original image is changed etc etc.

c)?
fields.summary: Export process is not able to export thumbnails.

fields.description:
If a plugin is modified and uploaded again, the velocity (vm) template does not update. For example:

1 - Upload "Plugin" jar
2 - Uninstalled "Plugin"
3 - modified the velocity template in the original plugin and packaged as a new jar
4 - Upload new "Plugin" jar

- The changes made to the velocity template does not show up in Confluence

Current workaround - rename the velocity template
fields.summary: Uploading a modified plugin with the same name does not update velocity template

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-3324].
  {panel}

When using page templates, variables are not recognized when they are inside of wiki constructs (e.g. [@@], {@@}).  
Here is an example of a template page, with variables that work and variables that don't:

Variables where they do _not_ work:

|inside link|[page title#@pageLink@]|
|inside include macro|{include:@contentPageName@}|

Variables where they _do_ work:

|inside plain text|Some random text @variable@|
fields.summary: Support replacement of page template variables in wiki links and macro parameters

fields.description:
Hi,

It looks like the backup formats are different from Confluence 1.4RC2 to Confluence 1.4 for the entities.xml file.

I've dug through both and here is one difference:

1.4RC2:
<property name="content">Return-Path: <dave@atlassian.com>
Received: from [192.168.0.71] (b128D.static.pacific.net.au [202.7.87.141])

1.4
<property name="content"><![CDATA[Return-Path: <charles@atlassian.com>
Received: from [192.168.0.56] (b128D.static.pacific.net.au [202.7.87.141])

This is one example of where the parser for 1.4 is choking on the restore.

We actually have some data in our 1.4RC2 instance.  I know that RC2 was unsupported. Short of pointing out a fix for that could you offer any advice? 

Attached are the two different files.  Seach on <dave@atlassian.com> in an editor with XML highlighting (JEdit or whatever) and you'll quicly see the differences.

I went in to try and manually fix a few things but no luck. Copied below is the top of the exception:
-----------------------------------------------------
2005-05-25 16:17:25,421 ERROR [atlassian.confluence.util.ReverseDatabinder] Erro
r parsing entities.xml : line [859], col [44].
org.xml.sax.SAXParseException: Element type "dave" must be followed by either at
tribute specifications, ">" or "/>".
        at org.apache.xerces.util.ErrorHandlerWrapper.createSAXParseException(Un
known Source)
        at org.apache.xerces.util.ErrorHandlerWrapper.fatalError(Unknown Source)

        at org.apache.xerces.impl.XMLErrorReporter.reportError(Unknown Source)
---------------------------------------------------
fields.summary: restore 1.4RC4 -> 1.4 xml parsing error

I cannot find any logs - where should they be?

I created a new pop account, entering my username and password (which work fine through other clients, such as outlook express).  Confluence just hangs and when I look at the account info I see the word ERROR in the description of the status of the account.

2005-05-24 23:32:09,020 WARN [atlassian.confluence.mail.DefaultMailAccountManager] Error connecting to mail server: hostname: f7.net username: pdobox

fields.description:
Doesn't really show you the "updated" content if it doesn't show you new comments!

Perhaps a flag to turn this off (but I think it's the default behaviour users would expect).

Also, if you flag to only see updates in one space (the default) you don't need the space name displayed with each entry!

fields.description:
The non-profit footer is too long at the moment, it reads:

"This site is running on Atlassian Confluence with a free Open Source Project / Non-profit License. Read more about Confluence licensing. Confluence is professional wiki, blog and knowledge management tool. Evaluate Confluence for your organisation."

Change it to:

"Site powered by a free Open Source Project / Non-profit License (more) of Confluence - the Enterprise wiki.
Learn more or evaluate Confluence in your organisation."

fields.description:
Viewing pages with lots of links causes lots of Database IO and takes approx 30 secs to display some of our pages.
Cannot use the index on TITLE as Sybase , SQL Server do not support functional indexes which would improve the lower() search queries for determining links on pages.

Somewhat randomly, a page will sometime only display the page title and no much else. This seems to be happening to the http://confluence.atlassian.com. I've seen this 3 or so times tonight.

fields.description:
We have our instance of confluence sitting on a web server behind a F5 loadbalancer which is (correctl) forcing https. The issue we have is that the login button does not try to redirect to https but to http.  Is there anyway to point it at https as we are getting redirect alerts.

Thank you
fields.summary: How do I force https:// on the login button

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-3290].
  {panel}

from Ruben Miranda on mailing list:

> Still, one thing that I think would help Confluence comments immensely, in
> addition to the separate tab - tracking the revision number of the page that
> was in effect when the comment was made. You could even add a link to that
> specific revision next to the comment header, just so you can see that
> comment in context. Others have commented on the staleness of comments
> relative to the content itself, so that might be a way to resolve any
> confusion.
fields.summary: Link comments to page version that was current when comment was made

fields.description: The "Insert Link" feature is pretty nice.  However, it would be even more useful if the window that pops up allowed some way to show the anchors on a particular page.  As it is right now; it's too painstaking to link to an anchor on another page without delving into the other page to figure out what the anchor is exactly.
fields.summary: Make easier to link to anchors on pages

fields.description:
If you have some text and then a newline and then a space and then text the lines join together. e.g. *Some text* This Displays at Some text This and not Some text
This As it should do.

Mail import is failing (silently) on oracle for a particular email (the fourth email in small-mbox.mbox file). By failing, I mean that the author and content are not being recorded.

Investigate.

fields.description:
boolean hasPermission(RemoteUser remoteUser, RemoteSpace remoteSpace, String[] permissions)
Returns true if the remoteUsers has all space permissions specified in the given array list permissions for the given space i.e. remoteSpace otherwise return false
fields.summary: Conflue needs hasPermission RPC

fields.description:
If page A links to page B and if you export page A without page B to HTML, page A will have been linked to B as though it had been exported - in other words, following the page B link will result in a missing resource.

It should link back to the originating Confluence instance for page B, if B was not exported.
fields.summary: HTML export of a space - links on pages always resolve locally, even if the linked page was not exported

fields.description: It would be nice to be able to list attachments in the order in which they were attached so that one could easily find the latest attachments. While file versions is great, in our case there are sometimes several related attachments with different names.
fields.summary: Allow attachments to be ordered by date, size and name in the attachments macro

fields.description:
Attachments in search results lead to pages with a '#attachments' anchor - valid for the 1.3.x view page outlay but not 1.4.

Fix so it leads to the attachment tab of the owning page, blog, or user profile.

fields.description:
The error below happens when exporting into HTML (and HTML only) a page or a space with a page whose name contains certain characters like double-quotes and question marks.
Disappointingly the reason for the failure seems like rather trivial: since no encoding is apparently applied on the file names, characters which are illegal in the underlying filesystem (Windows' in this case) are causing the blow up.
